The home team tries to prevail using combination football, while the away side attempt to win the ball back as quickly as possible every time they lose possession.

The away team was pressing and leaving the opponents little space for combination play.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a highly anticipated clash, Manchester City hosted Liverpool in a Premier League encounter that was set to be electrifying given the attacking prowess of both squads. By the final whistle, Liverpool had cemented a dominant 4-1 victory over City, outclassing their hosts in almost every facet of the game. Here’s a detailed account of the exhilarating match.

The match began with Liverpool kicking off, and from the outset, both teams displayed a high tempo, vying for early dominance. Within the first minute, Liverpool saw the ball go out of play, setting the pattern for a stop-start opening few minutes. Manchester City earned a corner in the third minute which saw their first shot on target, immediately putting Liverpool's defense on alert. However, it was called back for an offside, thwarting City’s premature celebration.

Liverpool soon found their stride, capitalizing on City's defensive frailties. The breakthrough came in the seventh minute when Liverpool seized an early lead through a clinical move finished off by their sharp offensive acumen. The rapid response from Manchester City to restart proceedings was palpable, yet they struggled to circumvent Liverpool's high press and disciplined backline.

Philippe Coutinho and Roberto Firmino showcased their synergy and skill as Liverpool's attacking duo, and in the 22nd minute, Firmino fed Coutinho, who calmly slotted the ball into an empty net, doubling Liverpool's advantage and sending the traveling supporters into raptures. The match restarted with City appearing shell-shocked, unable to muster a quick response.

City’s struggles continued as Liverpool dominated possession and kept probing their defensive lines. Just ten minutes after their second goal, Liverpool struck again. Coutinho once more turned provider, assisting Firmino for Liverpool's third goal in the 31st minute. Firmino found himself in a perfect position to tap the ball into an empty net, increasing Liverpool’s lead and leaving City in further disarray.

Manchester City carried on trying despite the swelling deficit. In the 43rd minute, they finally found a response. Sergio Aguero, their most reliable marksman, delivered a stunning goal from just outside the box, firing the ball with ferocity into the right post. This was a spark of hope for City before heading into halftime, with Liverpool leading 3-1.

Halftime saw City make two substitutions, an attempt by manager Manuel Pellegrini to recalibrate his team’s approach. Fabian Delph replaced Jesus Navas, and Fernandinho came on for Yaya Toure, signaling an intent to fortify both the midfield and attacking transitions.

As the second half commenced, City started on the front foot, earning a number of set-pieces and trying to press Liverpool higher up the pitch. Liverpool, however, remained resilient and organized, intercepting crucial passes and engineering swift counter-attacks.

The steadfastness of Liverpool’s defense was tested repeatedly, particularly when Kevin De Bruyne delivered accurate crosses into the box. Yet every effort was met with equally stern resistance from Liverpool’s backline and their goalkeeper, Simon Mignolet. The 54th minute saw Coutinho create another stirring moment by taking a shot from outside the box, which was blocked and resulted in a corner. Liverpool’s set-pieces continued to create threats, keeping City on the defensive.

City’s attacking efforts saw Aguero and Sterling linking up well with De Bruyne, trying to carve open Liverpool’s defense. Aguero came close again in the 74th minute but was denied by a superb Mignolet save. It showcased the strong resilience Liverpool had mustered in their ranks, with every City advance met with solid defending or a swift counter. City was to rue these missed chances as they struggled to find a way past an obstinate Liverpool side.

Liverpool’s dominance was further evident when they again found the net in the 81st minute. This time, it was Martin Skrtel who capitalized on a corner from Adam Lallana, slotting it past the City keeper to make it 4-1. The goal was the final nail in the coffin for City, whose defense had been undressed entirely by the ruthless efficiency of Liverpool’s attack.

As the game wound down, both teams continued to engage in spirited play, but the outcome had already been etched in the scoreboard. City fought hard to close the gap with some astute attacks yet continually found Liverpool's Mignolet an impenetrable wall. The tempo remained high until the final whistle, with City’s pressing continually snuffed out by Liverpool’s clinical counter defending. 

Jurgen Klopp made another substitution late in the game, replacing Philippe Coutinho with Jordon Ibe, clearly conserving energy and solidifying defensive effort after Coutinho picked up an injury. Klopp’s tactical acumen and pressing strategy had undeniably paid dividends.

Despite Manchester City's best efforts and several strategic changes including the introduction of Kelechi Iheanacho for Aguero, City could not turn the tide. Their possession strategy was outwitted by Liverpool's quick pressing and relentless countering, leaving them adrift and unable to claw back into the match.

Liverpool’s performance was a masterclass in away-game dominance. The fluid interchanging between their forwards, coupled with their combative midfield and unyielding defending, was too much for City to handle. The brace of Coutinho and Firmino, along with Skrtel’s clinical finish, overturned City’s defense repeatedly. Simon Mignolet cemented his man-of-the-match performance with critical saves that nullified City’s few but dangerous attacks.

The final whistle blew, and Liverpool triumphed 4-1, leaving City bewildered and their supporters disheartened. The away team's relentless pressing and quick passing left a lasting imprint of a well-executed tactical victory.

The match was a spectacle, draped in fervor and dramatics, and a joyous occasion for Liverpool supporters. Their team outshone a traditionally powerful Premier League foe with considerable finesse and discipline. For Manchester City, it was a match with agonizing lessons. Their defensive lapses and inability to cope with high-intensity pressing will need addressing moving forward. Managers and players alike on all sides will dissect this match in earnest, but for Liverpool, it was an unforgettable display of footballing prowess on enemy territory.
